module.name: Example project PC
module.description: The node contains a basic example for using VSCP.

reg.name: Zone
reg.description: Zone this module belongs to.

reg.name: Sub-zone
reg.description: Sub-zone this module belongs to.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: oaddr
reg.description: Originating address: Set to nickname for node that should trigger action. oaddr is the originating address. We are only interested in messages from the node given here. 0x00 is segment controller and 0xff is a node without a nickname. If bit 6 of flags is set, oaddr will not be checked and events from all nodes will be accepted.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: flags
reg.description: Flags: Set selection behaviour. The enable bit can be used to disable a decion matrix row while it is edited. The zone and sub-zone bits can be activated to have a check on the zone/sub-zone information of an event. The zone/sub-zone must match the one of the event to trigger the DM row.

bit.name: Class filter bit 8
bit.description: Defines the 9th bit of the class filter.

bit.name: Class mask bit 8
bit.description: Defines the 9th bit of the class mask.

bit.name: Reserved bit
bit.description: This bit is not used.

bit.name: Sub-zone match
bit.description: If set to one, sub-zone must match to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Zone match
bit.description: If set to one, zone must match to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Hardcoded
bit.description: If set to one, the originating address must be hardcoded to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Check Originating address
bit.description: If set to one, the originating address should be checked and match to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Enable
bit.description: Enable (1) or disable (0) the decison matrix row.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Class mask (low 8 bits)
reg.description: The lowest 8 bits of the class mask that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row. Bit 8 of the class mask is stored in bit 1 of the flag byte.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Class filter (low 8 bits)
reg.description: The lowest 8 bits of the class filter that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row. Bit 8 of the class filter is stored in bit 1 of the flag byte.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Type mask
reg.description: Type mask that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Type filter
reg.description: Type filter that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Action
reg.description: This is the action or operation that should be performed if the filtering is satisfied. Only action code 0×00 is predefined and means No-Operation. All other codes are application specific and typical application defined codes could do measurement, send predefined event etc.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Action parameter
reg.description: A numeric action parameter can be set and its meaning is application specific.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 2: oaddr
reg.description: Originating address: Set to nickname for node that should trigger action. oaddr is the originating address. We are only interested in messages from the node given here. 0x00 is segment controller and 0xff is a node without a nickname. If bit 6 of flags is set, oaddr will not be checked and events from all nodes will be accepted.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 2: flags
reg.description: Flags: Set selection behaviour. The enable bit can be used to disable a decion matrix row while it is edited. The zone and sub-zone bits can be activated to have a check on the zone/sub-zone information of an event. The zone/sub-zone must match the one of the event to trigger the DM row.

bit.name: Class filter bit 8
bit.description: Defines the 9th bit of the class filter.

bit.name: Class mask bit 8
bit.description: Defines the 9th bit of the class mask.

bit.name: Reserved bit
bit.description: This bit is not used.

bit.name: Sub-zone match
bit.description: If set to one, sub-zone must match to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Zone match
bit.description: If set to one, zone must match to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Hardcoded
bit.description: If set to one, the originating address must be hardcoded to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Check Originating address
bit.description: If set to one, the originating address should be checked and match to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Enable
bit.description: Enable (1) or disable (0) the decison matrix row.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 2: Type filter
reg.description: Type filter that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 2: Action
reg.description: This is the action or operation that should be performed if the filtering is satisfied. Only action code 0×00 is predefined and means No-Operation. All other codes are application specific and typical application defined codes could do measurement, send predefined event etc.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 2: Action parameter
reg.description: A numeric action parameter can be set and its meaning is application specific.

data.name: Lamp instances
data.description: The parameter is a bitfield, in which evey bit corresponds to a lamp.

action.name: Dim lamp
action.description: Dim one or more lamps. Please note that the action reacts only on class1.control dim lamp events!

event.name: Node heartbeat
event.description: The node sends every second a heartbeat.
